text: Thomas Dörflein (13 October 1963 – 22 September 2008) was a German zookeeper at the Berlin Zoo for 26 years. He became a celebrity after he took care of the polar bear cub Knut, who had been abandoned by his mother shortly after his birth in 2006. In 2007, Dörflein was awarded the Medal of Merit by the city of Berlin for helping to raise Knut. ==References== Category:1963 births Category:2008 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:People from Berlin Category:Zoos in Germany
